title: Sperm whale carcass that washed up on Nantucket ‘far too big’ to be removed from beach
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Local News The carcass of the endangered whale washed up on a Nantucket beach earlier this week and weighs more than 100,000 pounds.
A dead sperm whale washed up on Nantucket’s north shore Sunday, and marine officials have decided that it will not be removed due to its weight.

Marine Mammal Alliance Nantucket (MMAN), a volunteer non-profit organization dedicated to rescuing and protecting marine mammals on the island, determined that the roughly 50-foot male weighs approximately 52 tons, or 104,000 pounds, the organization said in a Facebook post.

title: N.H. middle schoolers used AI to create nudes of classmates, parents say
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Local News “Manipulated, AI-generated sexual or abusive content cannot be viewed as a prank.

” By Abby Patkin November 19, 2025 | 4:08 PM 2 minutes to read A New Hampshire middle school is in the spotlight after students allegedly used artificial intelligence to generate nude images of three female classmates, according to local news reports.
“It’s been very disturbing, it’s really been devastating, and it’s been infuriating,” one of the girls’ mothers told Boston 25 News.
